metadata.synopsis: Dialog with a child in Cazador's Dungeon. She's the daughter of a monster hunter you likely met before in the game. She's been turned into a vampire spawn, the kind of monster her family would normally hunt, and knows exactly how bad that is.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Origin Debug BookAstarion - Recruit As Companion (optional)Astarion - Act 3 Lower City - Cazador's Palace - CellsClick on the cell door with Gur Children (a dialog with adult prisoners might start before, just skip it and then click on the cell door with the children).

81.speaker: Chessa
81.text: This doesn't feel good. I don't like this.

117.speaker: Chessa
117.text: Hey, you! It's you isn't it? I remember that stupid hair.

47.speaker: Narrator
47.text: *Behind the glowing eyes and pallid skin, you recognise the faces of the children you took from the Gur hunters' camp on Cazador's orders.*

246.speaker: Chessa
246.text: You better watch out, our parents will be here soon. And when they find you, they'll - urgh.

229.speaker: Player
229.text: *You know that pain well. She's feeling the same hunger that's plagued you for two hundred years.*

167.text: *You know that pain well. She's feeling the same hunger that's plagued you for two hundred years.*

8.speaker: Narrator
8.text: *You know that pain well. She's feeling the same hunger that's plagued you for two hundred years.*

155.speaker: Chessa
155.text: What? What are you looking at?

102.speaker: Player
102.text: Your parents aren't coming. But I am. I'm here to save you.

18.speaker: Player
18.text: I never thought you'd end up like this. I'm so sorry.

49.speaker: Chessa
49.text: What? You expect me to believe that?

185.speaker: Chessa
185.text: You're the one that did this to us. You're the one that took us, and offered us up to be Cazador's spawns.

79.speaker: Player
79.text: And now I'm here to make amends.

53.speaker: Chessa
53.text: Amends? You think you can amend this?

28.speaker: Chessa
28.text: We were supposed to be hunters. We spent our whole lives training, studying... You were the one we were supposed to kill!

68.speaker: Chessa
68.text: Now we're no better than you. Worse. At least you get to roam free.

200.speaker: Player
200.text: I'm actually here to free you.

142.speaker: Player
142.text: You want sympathy because you can't hunt me like your parents did?

232.speaker: Chessa
232.text: My parents... I wonder how they're doing...

226.speaker: Player
226.text: You can tell them yourself when I free you.

37.speaker: Player
37.text: Don't think about it - that life is behind you now.

71.speaker: Chessa
71.text: We thought we'd figured it out at first - we could just stake ourselves with sharp twigs from the gutter and be done with it. But - it's harder than it looks.

38.speaker: Chessa
38.text: Even when we managed it, all it did was paralyse us. We tried twice each, just to be sure.

242.speaker: Player
242.text: Simple. I save your lives, your parents stop hunting me.

90.speaker: Chessa
90.text: Self-preservation - that actually makes sense. If you'd said anything else, I'd have struggled to believe you.

136.speaker: Chessa
136.text: Self-preservation - that actually makes sense. If you'd said anything else, I'd have struggled to believe you.

19.text: That's rubbish, and you know it! My parents would never stop hunting you.

62.speaker: Chessa
62.text: That's rubbish, and you know it! My parents would never stop hunting you.

84.speaker: Chessa
84.text: You're a monster. The worst kind. And you need to leave.

97.speaker: Player
97.text: I can't bear to see you suffering like this because of something I did.

133.speaker: Chessa
133.text: So what are you waiting for? Let us out!

111.speaker: Player
111.text: All right, I'll free you once I have the staff.

249.speaker: Player
249.text: I'll free you once I have Cazador's staff.

126.speaker: Player
126.text: I need to find the key to your cell first. Do you know where it is?

217.speaker: Player
217.text: Changed my mind. Maybe you should wait here until your parents arrive.

36.speaker: Chessa
36.text: You RAT! You raised our hopes just to kill them. You're worse than Cazador!

151.text: Uh huh. Sure, first you kidnap us and then you want to save us. That makes sense.

70.speaker: Chessa
70.text: Uh huh. Sure, first you kidnap us and then you want to save us. That makes sense.

192.speaker: Player
192.text: I'm not going to let Cazador take advantage of you like he took advantage of me.

206.speaker: Player
206.text: Because you're vampire spawn. You should be out in the world feasting, not locked in a dungeon!

202.text: That's... one way of looking at it.

11.speaker: Chessa
11.text: That's... one way of looking at it.

76.speaker: Player
76.text: Good point. There's no reason to free you. It's safer for everyone if you stay right where you are.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: It wouldn't solve anything, anyway. Not for your parents, not for you.

119.speaker: Chessa
119.text: Then what are we supposed to do?

115.speaker: Chessa
115.text: Hey, come back! Don't leave us here!

56.speaker: Player
56.text: Better off without you, I'd imagine, given what you've become.

173.speaker: Chessa
173.text: You could have just left us here to starve, you know. You didn't have to come and insult us. Arsehole.

240.speaker: Player
240.text: Quit whining. You're a vampire spawn now. That's much better than being human.

197.speaker: Chessa
197.text: But still not strong enough to get out of this place. Or away from Cazador.

61.speaker: Player
61.text: I wouldn't know would I? I've never been a human.

46.speaker: Chessa
46.text: Perhaps that's why you don't understand. You've never known what it truly means to be free. To be tracking prey in the wild...

24.speaker: Chessa
24.text: That's not a good thing. That was going to be our way out of this.

101.speaker: Chessa
101.text: As long as we're here, as long as Cazador's alive, we're - stuck.

63.speaker: Player
63.text: And roam free, I shall. Goodbye.

169.speaker: Player
169.text: Isn't it wonderful? A vast improvement.

214.speaker: Player
214.text: I regret it. I regret everything.

50.speaker: Player
50.text: If you're a spawn, then you understand how hard it is to resist Cazador's requests.

237.speaker: Chessa
237.text: But did you have to kidnap us?

65.speaker: Player
65.text: It hurts, doesn't it? The hunger.

154.speaker: Chessa
154.context: NodeContext: Seing kids he once kidnapped.

51.speaker: Player
51.context: NodeContext: Seing kids he once kidnapped.

98.speaker: Astarion
98.context: NodeContext: Seing kids he once kidnapped.

165.speaker: Player
165.text: It is you. I knew it!

215.speaker: Chessa
215.text: It is you. I knew it!

184.speaker: Chessa
184.text: I'll kill you! Once I get out of here I'LL KILL YOU!

41.speaker: Player
41.text: You're the children from the monster hunter's camp?
41.context: NodeContext: chastising herself in horror for forgetting about her parents now that the vampiric instinct has taken hold of her

248.speaker: Chessa
248.text: Camp... monster hunters... the Gur camp? Oh gods - my parents' camp!
248.context: NodeContext: chastising herself in horror for forgetting about her parents now that the vampiric instinct has taken hold of her

14.speaker: Chessa
14.text: Chessa, focus. Resist the beast inside you. You promised!
14.context: NodeContext: chastising herself in horror for forgetting about her parents now that the vampiric instinct has taken hold of her

194.speaker: Chessa
194.text: It's your fault. You did this to us.

42.speaker: Chessa
42.text: Didn't he tell you? He's the one that kidnapped us. He's the reason we're spawns. I'LL KILL YOU.
42.context: NodeContext: Talking to player about Astarion. Last line directed at Astarion.

43.speaker: Astarion
43.text: Ah. Ah-hah... yes, now that you mention it, I may have done... that.
43.context: NodeContext: sad, coming back to herself, remembering a lost life

73.speaker: Astarion
73.text: Don't look at me like that - Cazador's orders.
73.context: NodeContext: sad, coming back to herself, remembering a lost life

2.speaker: Astarion
2.text: Quite the deviation from my usual routine, of course. Capture, not lure. I didn't bring them in with sweetrolls or anything.
2.context: NodeContext: sad, coming back to herself, remembering a lost life

64.speaker: Astarion
64.text: I really forgot about them, felt nothing the moment I handed them over to him.
64.context: NodeContext: sad, coming back to herself, remembering a lost life

40.speaker: Player
40.text: We promised their parents we'd save them.
40.context: NodeContext: sad, coming back to herself, remembering a lost life

75.speaker: Chessa
75.context: NodeContext: sad, coming back to herself, remembering a lost life

164.speaker: Player
164.context: NodeContext: sentimental, but also confused, frustrated

221.speaker: Chessa
221.text: I miss them. I think. Or perhaps it's the hunger... oh I don't know. It's so hard to tell!
221.context: NodeContext: sentimental, but also confused, frustrated

110.speaker: Player
110.text: They'll be fine, so long as we free you from this place.

104.speaker: Chessa
104.text: I don't think I'll ever be able to go home. Not like this.

174.speaker: Chessa
174.text: You should go. Leave us here. We shouldn't be out there. We'd hurt our families.

89.speaker: Player
89.text: I'm going to help you. How do I free you?
89.context: NodeContext: a moment of pause, and shifting from anger to hope

21.speaker: Chessa
21.context: NodeContext: a moment of pause, and shifting from anger to hope

168.speaker: Player
168.text: I can't promise anything, but I'll try.

127.speaker: Astarion
127.text: What are you doing? They're going to tear me to shreds... They'd never forgive me for what I've done.

87.speaker: Player
87.text: Deep down somewhere, they're just kids who need our help.

205.speaker: Astarion
205.text: I was in the prime of my life when I was turned.

239.speaker: Astarion
239.text: Everything was taken from me, too.

120.speaker: Astarion
120.text: Of course I deserve it, but the countless others they'd feed from...

121.speaker: Player
121.text: You're making excuses. You just want to bury your sins.

57.speaker: Player
57.text: Feeding is not the same as killing. They can come back from the brink.

211.speaker: Astarion
211.text: I just... I never want to see these little scraps of misery again. The world doesn't need to know my shame.

105.speaker: Player
105.text: You're not honestly asking me to sacrifice them, are you?

150.speaker: Astarion
150.text: Maybe I am. Maybe that's what I have to do.

158.speaker: Player
158.text: Well, what else would you have me do?

245.speaker: Player
245.text: I've changed my mind. I think it's safer you stay right where you are.

67.speaker: Astarion
67.text: Might I recommend acquiring a taste for rats? They won't sate your appetite, but they help with the hunger.

12.speaker: Chessa
12.text: Rats. Great idea. Why didn't I think of that? I'll just find the hundred rats I'd need to even make a dent in this hunger.

178.speaker: Player
178.text: Never give up hope. Trust me, I know what I'm talking about.
178.context: NodeContext: First line, trying to think of something nice to say. Second line, realising that's the only nice thing you could possibly say to save her parents from pain.

172.speaker: Player
172.text: I'm sorry it had to end this way. Good luck to you.
172.context: NodeContext: First line, trying to think of something nice to say. Second line, realising that's the only nice thing you could possibly say to save her parents from pain.

227.speaker: Chessa
227.text: Tell them... tell them you couldn't find us.
227.context: NodeContext: First line, trying to think of something nice to say. Second line, realising that's the only nice thing you could possibly say to save her parents from pain.

83.speaker: Player
83.text: The world will be a safer place with you behind bars.

238.speaker: Player
238.text: Better off without you, now that I've seen what you've become.

175.speaker: Astarion
175.text: I couldn't have put it less delicately if I'd tried.

106.speaker: Player
106.text: We need to get these children out of here.
106.context: NodeContext: Italics spoken with psychopathic, vampire fury and hunger.

216.speaker: Chessa
216.text: We're not children! Don't call us children! We'll drink you dry.
216.context: NodeContext: Italics spoken with psychopathic, vampire fury and hunger.

223.speaker: Astarion
223.context: NodeContext: Italics spoken with psychopathic, vampire fury and hunger.

32.speaker: Chessa
32.context: NodeContext: Italics spoken with psychopathic, vampire fury and hunger.

183.speaker: Player
183.text: Cool it. I'll help you. But you need to tell us how to free you.

203.speaker: Player
203.text: You are definitely exactly where you belong. Safely locked away from the rest of us.

140.speaker: Chessa
140.text: I hope Cazador finds you and drains you to a husk.

124.speaker: Player
124.text: If we eliminate Cazador, will they be free?
124.context: NodeContext: Italics spoken with psychopathic, vampire fury and hunger.

141.speaker: Astarion
141.text: I suppose there's a good chance they will.

54.speaker: Astarion
54.text: What use is it, though? They're lost, ravenous, feral. They'd attack any mortal on sight.

186.speaker: Astarion
186.text: All these people were ruined because of me.

35.speaker: Player
35.text: If Cazador wants them, then Cazador can have them. Let's go.
35.context: NodeContext: Italics spoken with psychopathic, vampire fury and hunger.

244.speaker: Chessa
244.text: I hope he finds you and drains you to a husk.
244.context: NodeContext: Italics spoken with psychopathic, vampire fury and hunger.

91.speaker: Astarion
91.text: Well that could have gone better.

251.speaker: Player
251.text: Astarion, why do these children know you?

128.speaker: Astarion
128.text: I don't know what you mean. I've never seen these children in my life.

218.speaker: Chessa
218.text: LIAR! You're the one who kidnapped us! You're the reason we're spawns! I'LL KILL YOU.

15.speaker: Chessa
15.text: And it's all because of him.

17.speaker: Player
17.text: You'll do nothing of the sort. Astarion's with me.

22.speaker: Astarion
22.text: How chivalrous of you. As if I need defending from these children.

130.speaker: Chessa
130.text: If I ever get out of here, you'll wish you'd DIED when you were bitten!

170.speaker: Chessa
170.text: Smells fresh. Smells alive. Smells like... NO. Chessa, stop it. This isn't you!
170.context: CinematicNodeContext: Sniffing the air. NodeContext: Getting hungry, italics spoken like a psychopath succumbing to vampiric hunger. Then suddenly realising what they're saying, pulling back and mortified with themselves.

34.speaker: Player
34.text: Are you the kids from the Gur camp?
34.context: NodeContext: The Gur camp is precisely where they're from, but they've half-forgotten now that they're vampire spawn. She's thinking about it, and it stirs a memory, but it's foggy.

131.speaker: Chessa
131.text: The Gur camp, the Gur camp... Maybe? Yes. I think so.
131.context: NodeContext: The Gur camp is precisely where they're from, but they've half-forgotten now that they're vampire spawn. She's thinking about it, and it stirs a memory, but it's foggy.

80.speaker: Player
80.context: NodeContext: psychopathically cold, succumbing for a moment to vampiric instincts

82.speaker: Player
82.context: NodeContext: psychopathically cold, succumbing for a moment to vampiric instincts

235.speaker: Player
235.text: I don't like the way you're talking about me.
235.context: NodeContext: psychopathically cold, succumbing for a moment to vampiric instincts

88.speaker: Chessa
88.text: I don't like it any more than you do... but I'm hungry. Starved.
88.context: NodeContext: psychopathically cold, succumbing for a moment to vampiric instincts

233.speaker: Chessa
233.text: And you look a tasty treat... No, Chessa, NO. Gods, if I could only think, but this hunger...
233.context: NodeContext: psychopathically cold, succumbing for a moment to vampiric instincts

193.speaker: Player
193.text: *This is no ordinary hunger. This is the hunger of a vampire spawn. One that hasn't fed since it was created.*
193.context: NodeContext: dejected, whatever sliver of denial she was hanging onto is now gone

247.text: *This is no ordinary hunger. This is the hunger of a vampire spawn. One that hasn't fed since it was created.*
247.context: NodeContext: dejected, whatever sliver of denial she was hanging onto is now gone

123.speaker: Narrator
123.text: *This is no ordinary hunger. This is the hunger of a vampire spawn. One that hasn't fed since it was created.*
123.context: NodeContext: dejected, whatever sliver of denial she was hanging onto is now gone

74.speaker: Chessa
74.context: NodeContext: dejected, whatever sliver of denial she was hanging onto is now gone

39.speaker: Player
39.context: NodeContext: dejected, whatever sliver of denial she was hanging onto is now gone

208.speaker: Chessa
208.text: It's that obvious, is it? Urgh. Then there's no hope for us, even if we got out of here.
208.context: NodeContext: dejected, whatever sliver of denial she was hanging onto is now gone

85.speaker: Player
85.context: NodeContext: hungrily, giving into monstrous vampiric instincts, then catching herself and pulling back

0.speaker: Chessa
0.text: Because there's nothing to eat. Nothing I want to eat.
0.context: NodeContext: hungrily, giving into monstrous vampiric instincts, then catching herself and pulling back

113.speaker: Chessa
113.text: Except you. Chessa, STOP. I'm sorry.
113.context: NodeContext: hungrily, giving into monstrous vampiric instincts, then catching herself and pulling back

204.speaker: Chessa
204.context: NodeContext: horrified by her own monstrosity

100.speaker: Player
100.context: NodeContext: on the verge of tears as they're reminiscing and realising what they've become

4.speaker: Player
4.context: NodeContext: on the verge of tears as they're reminiscing and realising what they've become

116.speaker: Player
116.context: NodeContext: on the verge of tears as they're reminiscing and realising what they've become

148.speaker: Chessa
148.text: You know him? Then you understand...
148.context: NodeContext: on the verge of tears as they're reminiscing and realising what they've become

135.speaker: Chessa
135.text: His servant kidnapped us. The pretty one with the frilly clothes and white hair. One moment we're at camp. Then, the world goes dark.
135.context: NodeContext: on the verge of tears as they're reminiscing and realising what they've become

139.speaker: Chessa
139.text: The next thing I remember, there's someone breathing on my neck, a tongue, and then the pain...
139.context: NodeContext: on the verge of tears as they're reminiscing and realising what they've become

241.speaker: Chessa
241.text: All the monsters I ever met were in books. I never even made it to the adult hunt. But now I'm one of them. I'm a spawn.
241.context: NodeContext: on the verge of tears as they're reminiscing and realising what they've become

159.speaker: Chessa
159.text: Please, if you've any mercy, put us down like the prey we are.
159.context: NodeContext: Abrupt, frightening switch to a calm, cool, psychopathic vampiric instinct. Genuine evil.

95.speaker: Player
95.text: I'm here to free you. Not kill you.
95.context: NodeContext: Abrupt, frightening switch to a calm, cool, psychopathic vampiric instinct. Genuine evil.

222.speaker: Chessa
222.text: NO! No... you can't. You mustn't.
222.context: NodeContext: Abrupt, frightening switch to a calm, cool, psychopathic vampiric instinct. Genuine evil.

143.speaker: Chessa
143.text: I'll drink you dry as a desert.
143.context: NodeContext: Abrupt, frightening switch to a calm, cool, psychopathic vampiric instinct. Genuine evil.

234.speaker: Chessa
234.text: I'm sorry. It's the hunger... If you were to free us... there's no knowing what we'll do.

13.speaker: Player
13.text: Never give up hope. Trust me, I know what I'm talking about.

144.speaker: Player
144.text: Perhaps if Cazador's dead, you'll be truly free.

3.speaker: Narrator
3.text: *Behind the exhaustion, starvation, and fear - recognition stirs in her eyes, and with it - hope.*

94.speaker: Chessa
94.text: That's... true. The books said so. 'The spawn are only bound so long as their lord lives.'

255.speaker: Chessa
255.text: Cazador's got this staff - it controls the doors. If you get it, you can set everyone free. If you get it... somehow...

189.speaker: Player
189.text: I'll take my chances. How do I release you?

69.speaker: Player
69.text: All right, I'll free you once I have the staff.

145.speaker: Chessa
145.text: Good luck. If you fail, well - I suppose we'll be seeing you again in here.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: Well, I hope your parents come and visit you.

162.speaker: Chessa
162.text: I hope they don't. I hope they stay well away from here.

207.speaker: Player
207.text: I'm not going to kill you. I'm going to free you.
207.context: NodeContext: A child trying to convince us she's really bad.

253.speaker: Player
253.text: I'm not about to kill a child.
253.context: NodeContext: A child trying to convince us she's really bad.

96.speaker: Chessa
96.text: I'm not a child. I'm EVIL. I'm an evil monster!
96.context: NodeContext: A child trying to convince us she's really bad.

6.speaker: Chessa
6.text: I'm sorry. It's the hunger... It's worse than anything I've ever known... No matter what I do, it just doesn't stop.
6.context: NodeContext: catches herself, and abruptly switches back to apologetic child

7.speaker: Player
7.text: What if I free you? Will that help?
7.context: NodeContext: 'But yours...' referring to player's blood with hunger, before catching herself and chastising herself again for slipping into animalistic vampire instincts

166.speaker: Chessa
166.text: Did you not hear me? We're vampire spawn. And we're hungry. We'll be a risk to everything and everyone we meet!

66.speaker: Player
66.text: I'm here to kill Cazador. Perhaps once I do, the hunger will be over too.
66.context: NodeContext: 'But yours...' referring to player's blood with hunger, before catching herself and chastising herself again for slipping into animalistic vampire instincts

23.speaker: Player
23.text: It's a prison. There must be plenty of rats for you to eat?
23.context: NodeContext: 'But yours...' referring to player's blood with hunger, before catching herself and chastising herself again for slipping into animalistic vampire instincts

177.speaker: Chessa
177.text: Have you ever tried eating a rat? Stale as mouldy bread, their blood.
177.context: NodeContext: 'But yours...' referring to player's blood with hunger, before catching herself and chastising herself again for slipping into animalistic vampire instincts

108.speaker: Chessa
108.text: But yours... is off-limits! Off-limits, Chessa!
108.context: NodeContext: 'But yours...' referring to player's blood with hunger, before catching herself and chastising herself again for slipping into animalistic vampire instincts

1.speaker: Player
1.text: I think you're in the best place you could possibly be - safely behind bars.

250.speaker: Chessa
250.text: Now please leave. You're making me hungry.

99.speaker: Player
99.text: It won't make a difference. You're already dead.

103.speaker: Player
103.text: If you're Cazador's spawn, I'll let him do with you as he wishes.

179.speaker: Chessa
179.text: Please. Go away now. You're making the hunger worse.

5.speaker: Player
5.text: Let me get you out of there, and you can find something to eat.

228.speaker: Chessa
228.text: NO! Please - you can't. Not like this. Our families can't see what we've become. What Cazador turned us into.

157.speaker: Chessa
157.text: Leave us alone! You've done enough, freak.

209.speaker: Chessa
209.text: I wish I could see my father again.
